title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Cavaliers Edge Pistons on Hill's Historic Night**

**CLEVELAND (AP)** — On a night where offense was a premium for everyone else, Grant Hill authored a masterpiece that will echo through the annals of NBA history. Despite his superhuman effort, it was the Cleveland Cavaliers who escaped with a nail-biting 90-88 victory over the Detroit Pistons.

The story, however, was Hill. The Pistons' forward was simply unstoppable, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 46 points in a breathtaking display of offensive artistry. He attacked the rim with a relentless fury, hit mid-range jumpers with cold efficiency, and single-handedly kept Detroit afloat. While the rest of the Pistons struggled to find any rhythm, Hill was a one-man wrecking crew, carrying the entire offensive load on his shoulders against a stout Cavaliers defense.

Yet, his historic performance was ultimately marred by a single, costly mistake. With mere seconds remaining on the clock and his team trailing by two, Hill committed a critical turnover, snuffing out Detroit's last chance to force overtime or steal the win. His monumental 46 points were suddenly overshadowed by the final scoreboard.

The Cavaliers, led by Shawn Kemp's 20 points and 12 rebounds, did just enough to withstand Hill's onslaught. It was an ugly, grind-it-out Eastern Conference battle, but Cleveland found a way, capitalizing on the one pivotal error from an otherwise flawless opponent. They survived, but on this night, everyone in Gund Arena witnessed a performance for the ages, even in a crushing defeat. Grant Hill was legendary, but the ball, in the end, belonged to Cleveland.
